summary: The Belle Époque was a time of peace and prosperity in Europe, especially in France, from 1871 to 1914. It followed the Franco-Prussian War and ended with World War I. This period saw many advancements in science, technology, and the arts. Paris, in particular, became a hub for artists and writers, creating famous works. Europe was powerful and influential during this time, which is why it's often called a "Golden Age." It was only later that people started calling it the Belle Époque, meaning "Beautiful Era," when they compared it to the wars that came before and after.
title: Belle Époque
